column4: Does anybody knows what could be the worst thing that can happen if my filesystem is SEVERE damaged?
how about hardware? nothing bad will happen to the hardware like HD?
but basically it just happen at the software level right?
cause I mistakenly ran e2fsck and then I restarted and I got something like 'e2fsck: found some errors on the filesystem'
is it too bad? should I reinstall ubuntu again?
do you have a live CD?
you mean if Im running it on a LiveCD?
no, I mean, do you have one at hand?
I suggest you boot from it, then run 'sudo e2fsck -y /dev/sda9' (replacing your device name of course). After that, it should boot normally from HD.
I did a 'sudo e2fsck -y /dev/sda3' and I got '/dev/sda3: clean 116815/7192576 files....'
yes, but I don't think you've fixed the problem. Was the failure on a different filesystem, perhaps?
so far I remeber I did mistakenly the e2fsck on the /dev/sda3, so I think thats the one it should had the problems
okay, let's see what happens when you reboot from HD
alrighty I think everything seem to be working fine
